1.name: The Cihuateteo
1.description: The Cihuateteo were the spirits of women who dies in childbirth. As Childbirth was considered a battle, these spirits were those who fought and fell valiantly as a warrior.

2.name: Centzon Totochtin
2.description: An aggressive mystical rabbit has appeared.

3.name: Big Axolotl
3.description: A pale dog sized amphibian with gills.

4.name: Giant Axolotl
4.description: A pale porsche sized amphibian with gills.

5.name: Itzpapalotl
5.description: A fearsome skeletal warrior goddess who rules over the paradise world of Tamoanchan, where victims of infant mortality reside and where humans are created. Here grows the Suckling Tree which bears 400,000 nipples. Hm. Not too school-appropriate but very cool–and scary(?)–nonetheless. She is often depicted as a skeletal being with jaguar claws and wings edged by obsidian knifes. Beware of angering her! It might not end well for you.

6.name: Citlalicue
6.description: She is a creator goddess, goddess of the stars and the Milky Way, earth, death and darkness. The darkness of the temple just continuously reaffirms her existence in the darkness, the dread, and yet feeling like there is hope in the universe–as long as you respect the stars.
